ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this if you are really interested in development and have good knowledge of econometrics.
Yes I would to anyone who wants to understand development economics better.
Great course. Work load is not too heavy.
I definitely recommend the course to non-IDE students, who has interest in development economics.
Development Economics was the one class in the IDE program that had a more practical approach to economics. In that sense, it was very valuable. However, a lot could be improved.
I strongly recommend this course to other students with strong economic background. Students with non-economic background may find the material harder to grasp.
It will be difficult for someone who has never done econometrics before.

ECO732 is an in depth analysis of economic theory as it relates to development economics. It is not about specific development project, but focuses on issues of economic evaluation and growth with respect to development. I would recommend 732 to another student, assuming they were adequately prepared to take the class, and realized this is an economics course and not say, a course surveying development projects.
It's a good way to explore development economics that builds on some basic understanding of economic concepts and especially of econometric methods.
I would recommend the course to other students interested in development/development economics but would suggest that to get most from the course a understanding of econometrics is important.
Yes, if they're interested in the econometric side of development, it's a great course to pursue.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course required a term paper. It was great experience researching and writing the paper, and it enhanced my understanding of the field.
It has allowed me to know more about development issues.
All the theory models were very helpful for my career. The analysis of all the papers were a key learning tool for our future work expertise.
This course has helped me to understand how rural developments works and what are the challenges in practice.
The course expanded our empirical knowledge on development topics and made me aware of development issues in literatures.
